New Records: Bobby Witt Jr. clinched the batting title with a.332 average, nine points better than Vladimir Gurerro Jr.'s.323 mark
Key Match Events: The Royals clinched the No. 5 seed in the American League and a matchup with the No. 4-seed Orioles with a 4-2 win over the Braves
Michael Massey's three-run homer in the first inning off Braves' righty Charlie Morton gave the Royals a fast start
Kris Bubic earned his first career save
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals were looking to clinch the No. 5 seed in the American League and a matchup with the No. 4-seed Orioles
The team's travel plans to Baltimore for the best-of-three Wild Card Series were a priority
The Royals' success in the postgame meeting was acknowledged by manager Matt Quatraro
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals ended the '24 season with 86 wins, a 30-win improvement from '23, and went from 106 losses last year to the postseason this year
Manager Matt Quatraro expressed pride in the team's accomplishment and looked forward to the postseason
Bobby Witt Jr. reflected on his batting title and the team's success, crediting his teammates for putting him in good situations
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals will play the Orioles in a best-of-three Wild Card Series at Camden Yards
The team's postseason appearance is their first since 2015
Bobby Witt Jr. became the first shortstop in the history of the Major Leagues to record multiple 30-homer, 30-stolen base seasons
